channel.title: Projects on MohammadEhsan Akhavanpour
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on MohammadEhsan Akhavanpour

item.title: Project III: Uber Data Analysis using GCP, Python, and BigQuery
item.description: This project aims to analyze Uber data using an ensemble of modern tools and technologies. The goal is to understand patterns, draw insights, and inform decisions based on the analyzed data. The technologies used include Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Storage for housing the data, Python for scripting and data manipulation, Compute Instance for scalable computing power, Mage Data Pipeline Tool for managing and processing the data flow, BigQuery for querying large datasets, and Looker Studio for data visualization and exploration.

item.title: Project II: Real-Time Stock Market Data Engineering with Kafka, Python, and AWS
item.description: The project’s goal is to execute an end-to-end data engineering task on real-time stock market data. This involves using Apache Kafka to handle real-time data streaming and a suite of Python, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Glue, Athena, and SQL to support the data processing and analysis operations. The focus of this project is to leverage real-time stock market data and provide a comprehensive solution for handling and analyzing this data.

item.title: Project I: End-to-End Reddit Data Engineering with Python, Airflow, and AWS Services
item.description: This project entails an end-to-end data engineering task using Airflow and Python. It involves extracting data from Reddit using its API, transforming the data using Python, deploying the code on Airflow and Amazon EC2, and saving the final result on Amazon S3. The primary goal of this project is to conduct a comprehensive data engineering task, starting from data extraction to storing the final result. The project kicks off by extracting data from Reddit using its API.
